entries.meaning: A rotational motion, especially that given to a ball, in which the upper surface spins in the direction of motion.
examples: The tennis star was famed for her topspin.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, television, film, publishing) An edgy, quirky or otherwise engaging quality that holds the interest of the audience.
examples: Well remembered as a visual comedienne, she also had the verbal knack of putting all sorts of topspin on a line.

verbs.description: topspin (third-person singular simple present topspins, present participle topspinning, simple past and past participle topspun)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To spin (a ball) with this motion.
